title: masdd
author: masdd
content: Hello i need 0.03 btc loan i  want repay 0.04In 1 week I dont have collateralHere my address 1MwfR7uGzoPAzN2XDeuYVbVTLNnRTEQW5W

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Hi, I understand that you want a loan, but asking it in Bitcoin is a bit odd. Remember the phrase "don't trust, verify". Why should anyone trust you and send you 3 million sats?Forgive me if these things are common. However, I have never heard of anyone doing that.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: You won't get a loan without collateral that is valued 100% or greater than the loan amount that you are requesting. You're also a brand new account. Not even people who have been here for years and made thousands of posts get loans of this size.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: masdd on May 01, 2023, 01:45:10 PMI dont have collateralFuck off!

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Got you covered bro, The transaction got confirmed a few minutes back - https://mempool.space/tx/7d8ff8c4ebb0a475b521e2242e236b1f9890d8f7d0491055d5816e107ec145deRepayment address is: bc1qtjd0wqa0udrssuh5jm3x4n58nqugxc0hc8wj9pRepayment date: By 9th May 2023.

comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on May 01, 2023, 10:32:44 PMGot you covered bro, The transaction got confirmed a few minutes back - https://mempool.space/tx/7d8ff8c4ebb0a475b521e2242e236b1f9890d8f7d0491055d5816e107ec145deRepayment address is: bc1qtjd0wqa0udrssuh5jm3x4n58nqugxc0hc8wj9pRepayment date: By 9th May 2023.This is my address nothing  receved https://mempool.space/address/1MwfR7uGzoPAzN2XDeuYVbVTLNnRTEQW5W

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: Why did you leave me two positive trust ratings? I never lent you any coins. Please remove the ratings.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Interesting that you and kristycryptop felt the need to restart your loan applications when other users offered suggestions on how you can obtain a loan by providing collateral.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Timelord2067 on May 02, 2023, 04:10:34 PMInteresting that you and kristycryptop felt the need to restart your loan applications when other users offered suggestions on how you can obtain a loan by providing collateral.He forgot to log out of his account (kristycryptop) and ended up sending a neg to BitcoinGirl.Club after he replied to masdd this  Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=662330 kristycryptop    2023-05-02        bad words and behaviorThe accounts masdd and kristycryptop are definitely alts

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on May 02, 2023, 10:44:07 PMQuote from: Timelord2067 on May 02, 2023, 04:10:34 PMInteresting that you and kristycryptop felt the need to restart your loan applications when other users offered suggestions on how you can obtain a loan by providing collateral.He forgot to log out of his account (kristycryptop) and ended up sending a neg to BitcoinGirl.Club after he replied to masdd this  Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=662330 kristycryptop    2023-05-02        bad words and behaviorThe accounts masdd and kristycryptop are definitely altsNice catch there - I've created some flags for these newbie loan scammers.  Please support.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: The rash of these recent petulant, insolent loan requests from newbies refusing to accept "No" as an answer has me thinking they are all the same person behind these accounts.  Maybe the spoiled brat thinks that if he trolls the forum enough someone will take pity on him like TMAN did with elmanchez.  Unfortunately, elmanchez turned out to be exactly what we all feared he was in the first place; a scammer.Anyway, I'm almost certain that all of these recent newbie requests are coming from one person.  It started with that 16xypjnxlrew fool, moved on to the ps34 idiot, and there have been at least 4 or 5 more accounts mimicking the same behavior in recent months.  It's getting rather tiresome, and I'm sure the lenders are getting tired of their threads being spammed by this troll.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on May 02, 2023, 11:15:27 PMThe rash of these recent petulant, insolent loan requests from newbies refusing to accept "No" as an answer has me thinking they are all the same person behind these accounts.  Maybe the spoiled brat thinks that if he trolls the forum enough someone will take pity on him like TMAN did with elmanchez.  Unfortunately, elmanchez turned out to be exactly what we all feared he was in the first place; a scammer.Anyway, I'm almost certain that all of these recent newbie requests are coming from one person.  It started with that 16xypjnxlrew fool, moved on to the ps34 idiot, and there have been at least 4 or 5 more accounts mimicking the same behavior in recent months.  It's getting rather tiresome, and I'm sure the lenders are getting tired of their threads being spammed by this troll.Then there's Funexchange (not connected to the above, but then again, who knows?) add in sasa87it - I've just found another alt sucaforte87it Quote from: sucaforte87it on January 11, 2016, 10:13:37 PMAltro acquisto. Sempre tutto liscio. Sono sasa87it. Ho perso i dati di accesso del vecchio account[Google Translate]Quote from: sucaforte87it on January 11, 2016, 10:13:37 PMOther purchase. Always smooth.I'm sasa87it. I have lost my old account login details ... another flag ...

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: ps34 on May 03, 2023, 09:12:31 AMi'm sick and tired of these accusations  !! you tell me i'm a scammer and have alts this is my ONLY account if you have proof deliver this  but you can't so stop !I am assuming you are a good man. Why don't you have a real life friend who can even lend you $500?You have nothing to offer, no reason to come back which makes it easy to conclude you will just disappear after receiving even a $10 bill. You are a scammer for sure if even you don't have alt [very unlikely]
